subject: Communication
title: High-Context vs. Low-Context Cultures
description: A quick, practical guide to High-Context vs. Low-Context Cultures.

hook.text: In Japan, 'that would be difficult' means 'no.' In Germany, 'no' means 'no.' Same word, different universe.

buildup.text: Edward T. Hall divided cultures by context: high-context cultures communicate implicitly; low-context cultures.

discovery.text: High-context: Japan, China, Arab nations â€” meaning lives between the words.

twist.text: Neither is better. High-context preserves harmony but frustrates outsiders. Low-context is clear but can feel rude.

climax.text: Global teams fail when high-context members think low-context ones are rude, and low-context members think.

punchline.text: Some cultures say what they mean. Others mean what they don't say.

quiz.question: In a high-context culture, where does meaning primarily reside?
options: Between the words and in context
